title: How to Make Pork Chops With Stuffing

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.
Tear the white bread into pieces.
Chop the onion and celery.
Melt the butter in a large, deep skillet.
steps.description: Place it on the stove over medium heat, and let the butter completely melt.

steps.headline: Sauté the onion and celery.
steps.description: Cook them until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Sprinkle on the spices.
steps.description: Add the sage, rosemary, thyme, and salt and pepper to the onions and celery. Add salt and pepper to taste. Stir the mixture well with a wooden spoon or spatula.

steps.headline: Add the dried bread crumbs.
Stir in the broth.
steps.description: Make sure the ingredients are well incorporated.

steps.headline: Mix in the white bread.
steps.description: The mixture should be moist, but not too wet. Add more bread pieces if needed. If the mixture seems dry, add more broth.

steps.headline: Transfer the stuffing to a greased baking dish.
Place the stuffing in the oven for 30 minutes.
steps.description: While the stuffing is baking, make the pork chops.

steps.headline: Heat the oil in a large skillet.
steps.description: Place the skillet on the stove over medium high heat.

steps.headline: Season the pork chops.
steps.description: Sprinkle them on both sides with salt and pepper.

steps.headline: Lay the pork chops in the pan.
Cook the pork chops on the first side for 3-4 minutes.
steps.description: Cook them on the longer side if they're thicker than 1 inch (2.5 cm).

steps.headline: Flip the pork chops with tongs.
Cook them on the other side for 3-4 minutes.
Remove the pork chops to a plate.
Sprinkle the sage or basil into the hot skillet.
steps.description: Fry it until it turns crispy.

steps.headline: Move the fried sage or basil to a plate.

parts.name: Finishing the Pork Chops With Stuffing

steps.headline: Remove the stuffing from the oven.
steps.description: It's done when the top is brown and crispy.

steps.headline: Spoon stuffing onto plates.
steps.description: Use the spoon to make an indentation in each serving of stuffing.

steps.headline: Place a pork chop on each plate.
steps.description: Place them on top of the beds of stuffing.

steps.headline: Sprinkle the fried sage or basil over the pork chops.
Serve with a green salad.

text: Making the Stuffing Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.  Tear the white bread into pieces.  Chop the onion and celery.  Melt the butter in a large, deep skillet. Place it on the stove over medium heat, and let the butter completely melt. Sauté the onion and celery. Cook them until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. Sprinkle on the spices. Add the sage, rosemary, thyme, and salt and pepper to the onions and celery. Add salt and pepper to taste. Stir the mixture well with a wooden spoon or spatula. Add the dried bread crumbs.  Stir in the broth. Make sure the ingredients are well incorporated. Mix in the white bread. The mixture should be moist, but not too wet. Add more bread pieces if needed. If the mixture seems dry, add more broth. Transfer the stuffing to a greased baking dish.  Place the stuffing in the oven for 30 minutes. While the stuffing is baking, make the pork chops. Cooking the Pork Chops Heat the oil in a large skillet. Place the skillet on the stove over medium high heat. Season the pork chops. Sprinkle them on both sides with salt and pepper. Lay the pork chops in the pan.  Cook the pork chops on the first side for 3-4 minutes. Cook them on the longer side if they're thicker than 1 inch (2.5 cm). Flip the pork chops with tongs.  Cook them on the other side for 3-4 minutes.  Remove the pork chops to a plate.  Sprinkle the sage or basil into the hot skillet. Fry it until it turns crispy. Move the fried sage or basil to a plate.  Finishing the Pork Chops With Stuffing Remove the stuffing from the oven. It's done when the top is brown and crispy. Spoon stuffing onto plates. Use the spoon to make an indentation in each serving of stuffing. Place a pork chop on each plate. Place them on top of the beds of stuffing. Sprinkle the fried sage or basil over the pork chops.  Serve with a green salad.
